processing_time.database_access_version: Live web search results from Google on 2025-08-13
processing_time.notes: Identifier discovery was efficient due to clear labeling in the source document. A common OCR error (9 vs Y) in the DOI was identified and corrected.

study_identification.title: Robotically assisted treadmill exercise training for improving peak fitness in chronic motor incomplete spinal cord injury: A randomized controlled trial

authors.all_authors: Peter H. Gorman, William Scott, Henry York, Melita Theyagaraj, Naomi Price-Miller, Jean McQuaid, Megan Eyvazzadeh, Frederick M. Ivey, Richard F. Macko

study_identification.journal: The Journal of Spinal Cord Medicine

doi.source: Paper footer , OCR error '9' corrected to 'Y' based on external query.
doi.cross_verification: VERIFIED - DOI resolves to the correct article on PubMed (PMID: 25520035).
doi.notes: The DOI in the PDF is '10.1179/20457723149.0000000281'. The '9' is an OCR error and should be 'Y'. External verification confirmed the correct DOI.

pmid.source: External query: 'site:pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov "Robotically assisted treadmill exercise training for improving peak fitness in chronic motor incomplete spinal cord injury: A randomized controlled trial" Gorman PH'
pmid.cross_verification: VERIFIED - PubMed entry for this PMID correctly lists the study title, authors, and DOI.
pmid.notes: PMID was not present in the provided document but was successfully located via external database search.

registration_numbers.cross_verification: VERIFIED - Querying NCT00385918 on ClinicalTrials.gov leads to the correct study titled 'Robotically Assisted Treadmill Training in Spinal Cord Injury (SCI)'.
registration_numbers.notes: Registration number is clearly stated in the text and verified externally.

integrity_resources.author_query_methods: Queried full names of first and last authors.

registry_resources.query_strategies: Direct query using the NCT number.

retraction_investigation.findings: No findings found after querying PubMed, CrossRef, and Retraction Watch.

query_summary.search_terms_effective: DOI and PMID based searches were effective in confirming the absence of retraction notices.
query_summary.comprehensive_coverage: YES - Primary and secondary retraction databases were successfully queried.

retraction_investigation.limitations: No access to subscription-based sections of Retraction Watch.

expression_of_concern_investigation.findings: No findings found after querying PubMed.
expression_of_concern_investigation.corrections_found: No routine corrections or errata were found during the investigation.

query_summary.editorial_systems_investigated: None, as initial screening showed no issues.

team_integrity_investigation.findings: No integrity issues found for the first author (Peter H. Gorman) and last author (Richard F. Macko) after querying PubMed and Retraction Watch.

authors_investigated.findings: No retractions or misconduct records found.
No retractions or misconduct records found.

investigation_details.timeframe_covered: Not applicable, as searches cover all indexed time.

timing_analysis.retrospective_justification: No justification provided in the paper or registry entry. The delay is minor (approx. 1 month) for a pilot study.

primary_registration.registration_completeness: The registration is comprehensive, detailing the study protocol, inclusion/exclusion criteria, and outcome measures.

registration_amendments.changes_made: Updates include posting of results and changes to record status over the years.
registration_amendments.post_enrollment_changes: Standard updates to study status and results submission; no changes to primary outcomes or interventions noted after enrollment started.
registration_amendments.amendment_appropriateness: Amendments appear to be standard administrative updates over the long course of the trial.

registration_timing_investigation.limitations: The exact day of enrollment start in September 2006 is not specified, but the monthly data is sufficient to classify the registration as retrospective.

reliability_metrics.database_consistency: Results are consistent across all queried resources.
reliability_metrics.findings_quality: Strong findings (i.e., definitive absence of integrity issues in queried databases).

overall_analysis.major_limitations: None. All primary databases were accessible and provided clear results.
overall_analysis.methodology_effectiveness: The Identifier-First approach was highly effective. All necessary identifiers were found and verified, enabling a comprehensive and confident assessment.

metadata.database_access_method: Web search for all external databases - no direct API access
metadata.web_search_strategy: Site-specific searches to avoid rate limiting
metadata.rate_limiting_eliminated: YES - using web_search() instead of direct database APIs
metadata.special_notes: The study was found to be retrospectively registered by approximately one month. While this is a minor transparency issue, it does not significantly impact the trustworthiness of this pilot trial.
